content.raw:
After trying a few things, I came to conclusion that I shouldn't modify or try to use the code in ign.hh/cc for a C++/C API. The code in `ign.cc` is designed for command line interface usage, and includes `cout` and `error` messages that are not needed in a programmatic API.

I also don't want a user to include "ignition/fuel_tools/ign.hh" as the simplified programmatic interface file. It feels a bit odd.

The functions in `ign.cc` to download a model also do not match the interface expected by SDF. For example, I want to have the following line:
[sdf::setFindCallback(ignition::fuel_tools::fetchAsset);](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/112/wip-fuel-tools/diff#Lsrc/Server.ccT101)


So, I move `ign.hh` to the source directory so that it's not installed. I'll deprecrate the header for `fuel_tools2` in another PR.

The end result is that there is some duplicate code in `ign.cc` and `Interface.cc`. It's difficult to reduce the code duplication since `ign.cc` outputs more information to stdout. The amount of duplication is pretty minimal.

I also don't want a user to include "ignition/fuel_tools/ign.hh" as the simplified programmatic interface file. It feels a bit odd.

The functions in ign.cc to download a model also do not match the interface expected by SDF. For example, I want to have the following line: sdf::setFindCallback(ignition::fuel_tools::fetchAsset);

So, I move ign.hh to the source directory so that it's not installed. I'll deprecrate the header for fuel_tools2 in another PR.
